TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ITuple

Docs.summary: Defines a general-purpose Tuple implementation that allows acccess to Tuple instance members without knowing the underlying Tuple type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the `ITuple` interface to access individual elements of a Tuple instance without knowing beforehand the number or types of elements in the Tuple. You determine the number of items in the Tuple by retrieving the value of the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ITuple.Length%2A> property. You can then enumerate its elements by passing an index that ranges from zero to one less than value of the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ITuple.Length%2A> property to the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ITuple.Item%2A> property.
`ITuple` is an explicit interface implementation of the `Tuple` classes and the `ValueTuple` structures. You must cast the `Tuple` object to an `ITuple` interface object before you can access its properties.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(index As Integer) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ default[int] { System::Object ^ get(int index); };

Docs.param: The index of the specified element. index can range from 0 for of the to one less than the number of elements in the .
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the specified element.
Docs.value: The value of the specified element.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Length As Integer
public: property int Length { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of elements in this instance.
Docs.value: The number of elements in this instance.
